bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 115 (Monday, July 3, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. WASSERMAN SCHULTZ:H.R. 4465.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Pursuant to Article I, Section 8, Clause 3 relating to thepower of Congress to regulate Commerce with foreign Nations,and among the several States, and with the Indian Tribes.The single subject of this legislation is:Authorizes the use of funds for safety improvements tocondominiums[Page H3166]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

summary.text:
Making Condos Safer and Affordable Act of 2023

This bill allows the Federal Housing Administration (FHA) to insure a mortgage taken out by a condominium association for the purpose of repairs, improvements, or alterations to any common system, infrastructure, or facility of the condominium.

The bill also allows the FHA to insure a mortgage taken out by a condominium unit owner to pay for special assessments charged by the association for repairs, improvements, or alterations to any common system, infrastructure, or facility of the condominium.

bill.title: Making Condos Safer and Affordable Act of 2023

item.title: Making Condos Safer and Affordable Act of 2023
Making Condos Safer and Affordable Act of 2023
To amend the National Housing Act to authorize insurance of certain mortgages to finance repairs and improvements to condominium projects, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
